name: The Bravery
description:
'''The Bravery''' is an American [[Rock music|rock]] band formed in [[New York City]] in 2003. The band consists of lead vocalist [[Sam Endicott]], guitarist [[Michael Zakarin]], keyboardist John Conway, bassist Mike Hindert and drummer Anthony Burulcich. They are best known for their 2005 top 10 UK single "[[An Honest Mistake]]" and their certified gold 2008 single "[[Believe (The Bravery song)|Believe]]". Before their initial split, they released three studio albums: ''[[The Bravery (album)|The Bravery]]'' (2005), ''[[The Sun and the Moon (The Bravery album)|The Sun and the Moon]]'' (2007) and ''[[Stir the Blood]]'' (2009). They also released a remixed edition of their second album, called ''[[The Sun and the Moon Complete]]'', in 2008, as well as an [[digital music|Internet live album]] called ''Live at the Wiltern Theater'' in 2010. The group's music is mostly [[post-punk]], [[dance music|dance]]-influenced rock.

The band was inactive from the early 2010s onward, with Endicott confirming the band's indefinite hiatus in April 2014. On July 31, 2021, The Bravery's website confirmed the return of the group.
